Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
  BasicMatrix
      Matrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
BasicMatrixInterface, MatrixOperationsInterface
public class Matrix
extends BasicMatrix
implements MatrixOperationsInterface

This class extends the functionality of the BasicMatrix by implementing the common Matrix operations specified in MatrixOperationsInterface. Direct access to the 2-D array is not possible (declared private in BasicMatrix), but use of the public BasicMatrix methods is all that is required to perform the operations.

Constructor Detail

Matrix

public Matrix(int rows,
              int columns)
       throws MatrixException
Constructor to create the Matrix with the given size.
Preconditions: Valid number of rows and columns specified.
Postconditions: The Matrix object is created and is ready for use.
Throws: MatrixException if rows or columns < 1.
Note: Ragged Matrices are not allowed (Matrices will always be rectangular).

Method Detail

add

public MatrixOperationsInterface add(MatrixOperationsInterface otherMatrix)
                              throws MatrixException
Description copied from interface: MatrixOperationsInterface
Method to add two matrices together.
Preconditions: A Matrix with dimensions compatible to this is passed in (not null).
Postconditions: A new Matrix that is the result of adding this with the passed in Matrix is returned. The original Matrices are unaffected.

Specified by:
add in interface MatrixOperationsInterface
Parameters:
otherMatrix - The Matrix to be added to the active Matrix.
Returns:
A new Matrix which is the result of adding the active Matrix with otherMatrix.
Throws:
MatrixException - if the two matrices cannot be added together (dimensions are not compatible).

multiply

public MatrixOperationsInterface multiply(MatrixOperationsInterface otherMatrix)
                                   throws MatrixException
Description copied from interface: MatrixOperationsInterface
Method to multiply two matrices together.
Preconditions: A Matrix with dimensions compatible to this is passed in (not null).
Postconditions: A new Matrix that is the result of mulitplying this with the passed in Matrix is returned (the parameter Matrix is on the right). The original Matrices are unaffected.
Throws: MatrixException if the two matrices cannot be multiplied together (dimensions are not compatible).
Note: This method could be made static if two Matrices are passed in.

Specified by:
multiply in interface MatrixOperationsInterface
Parameters:
otherMatrix - The Matrix to be mulitplied (on the right) to the active Matrix.
Returns:
A new Matrix which is the result of multiplying the active Matrix with otherMatrix (otherMatrix is on the right).
Throws:
MatrixException

transpose

public MatrixOperationsInterface transpose()
Description copied from interface: MatrixOperationsInterface
Method to return the transpose of the active Matrix.
Preconditions: None.
Postconditions: A new Matrix that is the result of taking the transpose of this is returned. The original Matrix is unaffected.
Throws: None.

Specified by:
transpose in interface MatrixOperationsInterface
Returns:
A new Matrix which is the transpose of the active Matrix.

determinant

public double determinant()
Description copied from interface: MatrixOperationsInterface
Method to return the determinant of the active Matrix.
Preconditions: The active Matrix must be square.
Postconditions: The determinant of the active Matrix is returned as a double.
Throws: MatrixException if the active Matrix is not square.
Note: One should not mention how the determinant calculation is implemented (in our case, recursively).

Specified by:
determinant in interface MatrixOperationsInterface
Returns:
The determinant of the Matrix.

inverse

public MatrixOperationsInterface inverse()
                                  throws MatrixException
Description copied from interface: MatrixOperationsInterface
Method to return the inverse of the active Matrix.
Preconditions: The active Matrix must have a nonzero determinant (which means that it also must be square).
Postconditions: The inverse of the active Matrix is returned. The original Matrix is unaffected.

Specified by:
inverse in interface MatrixOperationsInterface
Returns:
The inverse of the Matrix.
Throws:
MatrixException - if the active Matrix has a zero determinant or is not square.
